block.p: Valerie Blanchette Rockefeller, the daughter of Senator John D. Rockefeller IV and Mrs. Rockefeller of Charleston, W.Va., and Washington, was married yesterday to James Douglas Carnegie, a son of Sir Roderick and Lady Carnegie of Melbourne, Australia. The Rev. Daniel R. Heischman, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Washington National Cathedral.

Mrs. Carnegie, 29, is a candidate for a master's degree in special education at the Bank Street College of Education in New York. She graduated from Stanford University and received a master's degree in social-studies education from Columbia University. She is also a trustee of Spelman College in Atlanta.

Valerie Blanchette Rockefeller, the daughter of Senator John D. Rockefeller IV and Mrs. Rockefeller of Charleston, W.Va., and Washington, was married yesterday to James Douglas Carnegie, a son of Sir Roderick and Lady Carnegie of Melbourne, Australia. The Rev. Daniel R. Heischman, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Washington National Cathedral.

Mrs. Carnegie, 29, is a candidate for a master's degree in special education at the Bank Street College of Education in New York. She graduated from Stanford University and received a master's degree in social-studies education from Columbia University. She is also a trustee of Spelman College in Atlanta.

The bride's father, who is known as Jay, is a West Virginia Democrat serving his third term in the United States Senate. He was the state's governor from 1976 to 1984. Her mother, Sharon Percy Rockefeller, is the president and chief executive of WETA, public radio and television stations in Arlington, Va., that serve the Washington area.
The bride is a granddaughter of former Senator Charles H. Percy and Mrs. Percy of Washington, and of the late Blanchette Ferry Hooker Rockefeller and John D. Rockefeller III of New York.

Mr. Carnegie, 33, is an associate director at the Macquarie Bank, in Sydney, where he analyzes and executes transactions for its investment funds. He graduated from Melbourne University and received an M.B.A. degree with distinction from Harvard University. His father retired as the chairman and chief executive of Conzinc Riotinto of Australia, a mining company, in Melbourne.
The couple met in New York in April 1998 on a date arranged by a mutual friend of their families.
